note.desc: The oldest Mss. (fragments) from the local collection date to the 15th cent.
note.ab: Däbr. Formerly, the church of Mästǝḥ ʾAbunä Libanos existed in the vicinity of Mǝdrä Ruba. According to the local people, some time in 1970s the community decided that it should be merged with the church of Mǝdrä Ruba Śǝllase. Therefore the tabot(s), books and church utensils of Mästǝḥ were moved to Mǝdrä Ruba Śǝllase. Tabos (7): Libanos, Mary, Michael, Qirqos, Trinity, Gabriel, ʾAnanya.

46 Mss. photographed: MR-001 "Miracles of Mary"; MR-002 "The Book of the Funeral Rite"; MR-003 "Synaxarion"; MR-004 "Liturgical Texts; Prayer of Incense"; MR-005 "The Organ of Praise"; MR-006 "Prayers"; MR-007 "Missal"; MR-008 "Missal"; MR-009 "Homily of the Sabbath"; MR-010 "The Book of the Matrimony Rite"; MR-011 "Acts of the Apostles"; MR-012 "Homily of the Sabbath"; MR-013 "Missal"; MR-014 "Vita of John the Baptist"; MR-014b "Missal"; MR-015 "Vita of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus"; MR-016 "Prayer of the Saviour of the World"; MR-017 "Prayer of Incense"; MR-018 "Book of Mǝʿraf-Hymns"; MR-019 "Missal"; MR-020 "Collection of Miracles of Mary; Jesus and other texts"; MR-021 "Psalter"; MR-022 "The Book of the Funeral Rite"; MR-023 "Vita of Cyriacus"; MR-024 "Book of ʾAsläṭi"; MR-025 "Missal"; MR-026 "Four Gospels"; MR-027 "The Book of the Hours"; MR-028 "Miracles of Jesus"; MR-029 "Miracles of Jesus"; MR-030 "Collection of homilies"; MR-031 "Psalter of the Night"; MR-032 "Four Gospels"; MR-033 "Four Gospels"; MR-033b "Homily of St. Michael"; MR-034 "Missal"; MR-035 "History of Ethiopia"; MR-036 "Vita of Täklä Haymanot"; MR-037 "Synaxarion"; MR-038 "Vita of Täklä Haymanot"; MR-039 "The Book of the Baptismal Rite"; MR-040 "The Book of the Baptismal Rite"; MR-041 "Synaxarion (December)"; MR-043 "Story of the Trynity" and different texts"; MR-045 "The Faith of the Fathers" and an Amharic treatise.
The library of the church incorporated books from a church dedicated to Libanos (Libanos of Mäsṭǝḥ), which does not exist any more, as well as the church of Däbrä Mikaʾel ʾƎnba Ḥarisay (the church of the people ʾƎnba/ʾƎmba Ḥarisay/Ḥarišay), which most probably also does not exist any more.
